question: How to delete a company present on BKWeb on Windows/PC/Laptop?
answer: To delete a BKWeb company, go to Dashboard > Click on Company name > Click on Book Keeper Web > Click on Delete Company > Click on Yes. Your company will be scheduled for deletion. If you do not open this company in the next 7 days, it will be deleted. To cancel deletion, simply open the company again.

question: How to delete BKWeb company on Android?
answer: On Android, tap the three lines (â˜°) on the top left > Tap Add/Change Company. It will open a list of companies. Tap the three dots next to your company name, then select 'Delete from BKWeb'. The company will be scheduled for deletion in 7 days. To cancel deletion, just open the company again.

question: How to use BookKeeper on MacBook/iMac?
answer: Book Keeper is designed for Windows, but you can use it on a Mac with some workarounds. Follow the guide here: https://book-keeper-app.document360.io/docs/how-to-install-book-keeper-on-mac-book-keeper-mac-macbook-mac-os-macbook-pro-macbook-air

question: How to Make Accounts Active/InActive in Book Keeper?
answer:
Only available for Diamond Plan users. On Windows: Dashboard > All Accounts > Select account > Edit > Set status to Active or Inactive. Filter using: Diamond Plan > Display Active/Inactive Accounts.
On Android: Dashboard > Customers/Suppliers > 3 dots next to account name > Edit > Set to Active/Inactive.
More info: https://book-keeper-app.document360.io/docs/how-to-make-accounts-activeinactive-in-book-keeper

question: How to make Inventory Items as Active/Inactive. I want to delete inventory items but it says Item cannot be deleted.
answer:
If an item is used in sale/purchase vouchers, it cannot be deleted. Instead, mark it as Inactive.
On Windows: Dashboard > Inventory Item > Select 'All' in Active Items dropdown > Mark 'False' to make inactive, 'True' to make active.
On Android: Dashboard > Inventory Items > 3 lines top right > Edit Active/Inactive > Apply > Unselect items to mark inactive.
More info: https://book-keeper-app.document360.io/docs/mark-inventory-items-as-activeinactive-deactivate-inventory-items

question: How can I import Items or Services from Excel in Bookkeeper?
answer:
For Local company: Dashboard > Tools > Import item/services from Excel
For BKWeb company: Gold Plan > Export/Import Item/Service from Excel
Steps:
1. Select Inventory Items/Services
2. Download sample Excel
3. Fill in data
4. Browse and import file
5. Use 'Update Existing Items' or 'Ignore Existing Items'
6. Click Start Import

question: How can I import Customers or Suppliers from Excel in Bookkeeper?
answer:
For Local company: Dashboard > Tools > Import Customers/Suppliers from Excel
For BKWeb company: Gold Plan > Export/Import Customers/Suppliers from Excel
Steps:
1. Select Customer/Supplier/Other Accounts/Employee
2. Download sample Excel file
3. Fill in data
4. Upload file
5. Click Start Import

question: How can I import Transactions from Excel in Bookkeeper?
answer:
Transaction import is only available for Local or Dropbox-based companies.
Steps:
1. Dashboard > Tools > Import Transaction from Excel
2. Select Import Type
3. Download sample Excel file
4. Fill file
5. Import and verify

question: Is transaction import available for BKWeb companies?
answer: No, importing transactions from Excel is only available for Local or Dropbox-based companies.

question: How to use Multiple Pricing feature?
answer:
Windows: Settings > Transaction Settings > Date and Rate > Enable Multiple Pricing (up to 7 levels)
Android: Watch video: https://youtu.be/cW_7MS8OuW0?si=2ZBwd997hmFS2CQL
More info: https://book-keeper-app.document360.io/docs/how-to-use-multiple-pricing
